intro: Guarea perrottetii, commonly known as the blackwood tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes species known for their aromatic wood and medicinal properties. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall, featuring a straight trunk and dense, dark green foliage. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in axillary inflorescences, and it produces woody capsules containing small, flat seeds. The bark and leaves of Guarea perrottetii have been traditionally used in folk medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
